_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Categorical, non quantitative value.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This term represents a *category*, does *not represent* a [quantity](_class_quantity) and takes a *finite number of values*, can be *nominal* or *ordinal*.

_examples.iso_639_3_eng: Categorical example data could be *months*, *sex*, *countries*. By definition, any value that must be taken from a *controlled vocabulary* is a *categorical value*.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Discrete or continuous quantitative value.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This term represents a *quantity*, a *discrete* or *continuous* value, it does not represent a [category](_class_category) and can take an *infinite number of values*, it is by definition *numeric*.

_examples.iso_639_3_eng: Quantitative example data could be *height*, *weight*, *number of inhabitants*. In general, any value that represents *amounts* or *actual measurements*, would be considered a *quantitative value*.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: A value that indicates a moment in time.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This term represents a *date* or *time*, a value that could be used in a *time series* to indicate the *when*.

_examples.iso_639_3_eng: Time example data could be a *date*, a *date and time*, a *day* of the *week*.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Descriptive non quantitative or categorical value.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This term represents a *name* or *hash*, does *not* represent a *quantity* and does not represent a *category*, can take an *infinite number of values*.

_examples.iso_639_3_eng: Data that is *neither quantitative nor categorical* could be a person's *name*, a *social security number* or a *description* text. In general such data can take an infinite amount of values and does not represent an amount.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: True or false value
Discrete value.
Numeric value that can be continuous or discrete.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Floating point or integer numeric value. *Note that by definition the value will be treated as floating point*.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Character or text value.
The value must belong to a controlled vocabulary

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The value must be *chosen* from a *set* of *values belonging* to a *controlled vocabulary*, the value will be the *global identifier* of the enumeration *element*. Controlled vocabularies are organised as a directed graph in which terms are the nodes.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Reference to a specific database record.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This value represents the *unique identifier* of a *record* at the *database level*. It is the `_id `of a database record. This value references a single record among all collections in the database.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: timestamp expressed in the native database format.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This value represents a *time stamp* expressed in the *native format* of the *database*. It should be able to *express* a *precise moment* in time.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Data structure or object.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: An *object* type represents a *data structure*. It is implemented as a *directed graph* in which *nodes* are the *structure property descriptors*.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: [Markdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown) formatted text
[HyperText](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML) markdown formatted text.
A string representing a [Uniform Resource Identifier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Identifier), equivalent to the `uri` format in JSON Schema.
A string representing a [hexadecimal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hexadecimal) value.

Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) is an XML-based vector image format for two-dimensional graphics with support for interactivity and animation. The SVG specification is an open standard developed by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) since 1999.
*String* containing an *e-mail* address.
A string representing a date expressed in the `YYYYMMDD` format, in which `Y` stands for year, `M` stands for month and `D` stands for day. The date may omit the day, or omit the day and month.
A *string* representing a *date*. Equivalent to the `date` format in JSON Schema.
A *string* representing a *time*. Equivalent to the `time` format in JSON Schema.
A *string* representing a *date* and *time*. Equivalent to the `date-time` format in JSON Schema.

A *string* representing an internet *host name*.

Equivalent to the `hostname` format in JSON Schema.

A *string* representing an *IPv4* internet *address*, according to dotted-quad ABNF syntax as defined in RFC 2673, section 3.2.

Equivalent to the `ipv4` format in JSON Schema.

A *string* representing an *IPv6* internet *address*, as defined in RFC 2373, section 2.2.

Equivalent to the `ipv6` format in JSON Schema.
